sn35.159:0.3: Focus, the Exterior, and the End of Relishing
sn35.159:1.1: “Mendicants, rationally apply the mind to sights. Truly see the impermanence of sights.
sn35.159:1.2: When a mendicant does this, they grow disillusioned with sights.
sn35.159:1.3: When relishing ends, greed ends. When greed ends, relishing ends.
sn35.159:1.5: When relishing and greed end, the mind is said to be well freed.
sn35.159:1.6: Rationally apply the mind to sounds …
sn35.159:1.10: ideas. Truly see the impermanence of ideas.
sn35.159:1.11: When a mendicant does this, they grow disillusioned with ideas.
sn35.159:1.14: When relishing and greed end, the mind is said to be well freed.”
